Package fi.tuni.prog3.junitorder

Class Order

java.lang.Object
fi.tuni.prog3.junitorder.Order
public class Order extends Object
A class for representing an order that contains zero or more entries.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    Order.Entry
    A class for representing an order entry that consists of an item and an item unit count.
    static class 
    Order.Item
    A class for representing an item that has a name and a unit price.

  • Constructor Details

    • Order

      public Order()
      Constructs an initially empty order.

  • Method Details

    • addItems

      public boolean addItems(Order.Item item, int count) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Adds count units of an item to the order.

      Note: If the order already contains an entry for the specified item (based on having the same item name), the existing entry's item count is incremented by count. Otherwise a new entry with the specified item and item unit count is added to the order.

      Parameters:
      item - the added item.
      count - the item unit count to add.
      Returns:
      true if the items were added without errors.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the item unit count to add is not positive.
      IllegalStateException - if an existing entry has the same item name but a different price than the added item.

    • addItems

      public boolean addItems(String name, int count) throws IllegalArgumentException, NoSuchElementException
      Adds count units of an item to the order.

      Note: The order is expected to already contain an entry with the specified item name, and this function will increment that entry's item count by count.

      Parameters:
      name - the name of the added item.
      count - the item unit count to add.
      Returns:
      true if the items were added without errors.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the item unit count to add is not positive.
      NoSuchElementException - if the order does not contain an entry with the specified item name.

    • getEntries

      public List<Order.Entry> getEntries()
      Returns the order entries in their original adding order.

      Note: the returned list is a copy, so modifying it will not affect the internal state of the order.

      Returns:
      the current entries of the order.

    • getEntryCount

      public int getEntryCount()
      Returns the total number of item entries in this order.
      Returns:
      the total number of item entries in this order.

    • getItemCount

      public int getItemCount()
      Returns the total number of entries in this order (= sum of all entries' counts).
      Returns:
      the total number of entries in this order.

    • getTotalPrice

      public double getTotalPrice()
      Returns the total price of the order.
      Returns:
      the total price of the order.

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Tells whether the order is empty.
      Returns:
      true if the order is empty, otherwise false.

    • removeItems

      public boolean removeItems(String name, int count) throws IllegalArgumentException, NoSuchElementException
      Removes count units of an item from the order.

      Note: If the order already contains an entry for the specified item (based on having the same item name), the existing entry's item count is decremented by count. If the item count becomes zero, the item entry is removed from the order.

      Parameters:
      name - the name of the removed item.
      count - the item unit count to remove.
      Returns:
      true if the items were removed without errors.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the item unit count to remove is not positive or is larger than the corresponding existing entry's item unit count.
      NoSuchElementException - if the order does not contain an entry with the specified item name.
